meanings.definition: To wear out through use or time.
meanings.sent1: Running in the rain can outwear your shoes quickly.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite dress outwears all the others in her closet.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outwear a pair of sneakers with holes is a losing battle.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge has outworn its welcome and needs to be replaced.
meanings.sent5: The constant friction will eventually outwear the fabric of the couch.

meanings.definition: To last longer than something else.
meanings.sent1: Quality products tend to outwear cheaper alternatives.
meanings.sent2: His determination to succeed will outwear any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between the two outwears any disagreements they may have.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins have outworn the memories of those who built them.
meanings.sent5: The love for music can outwear the passing trends of the industry.

meanings.sent1: Playing tag can quickly outwear young children.
meanings.sent2: The long hike outwore him, but he felt accomplished.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outwear a hyperactive puppy is a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The endless meetings outwore the employees, leading to burnout.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout routine will outwear even the fittest athletes.
